main event: A brief observation of flashes resembling explosions over Lake Erie, believed to be caused by the planet Venus.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for 30-45 minutes with flashes at intervals of 5-10 seconds., The observer reported seeing flashes that appeared like explosion flashes., Investigators concluded the flashes were reflections or refractions of Venus., The azimuth and elevation of the observation were consistent with the position of Venus at the time., Three witnesses confirmed the sighting and described similar phenomena.
sighted object: flashes of light in the sky
witness description: Three eyewitnesses described flashes seen over Lake Erie, consistent with Venus.
